intro: Calandrinia leucotricha, commonly known as the silverleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage and small, pink to purple flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Calandrinia leucotricha is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
